# mittwald_server (Resource)

This resource models a server on the mittwald cloud platform; a server is always provisioned for a customer, and usually incurs costs to the user.

## Example Usage

```terraform
variable "customer_id" {
  type = string
}

resource "mittwald_server" "example" {
  customer_id = var.customer_id
  description = "Test server"

  volume_size = 100
  machine_type = {
    name = "shared.xlarge"
  }

  use_free_trial = true
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `description` (String) Description for your server
- `machine_type` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--machine_type))
- `volume_size` (Number) The size of the server's volume in GB

### Optional

> **NOTE**: [Write-only arguments](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/resources/ephemeral#write-only-arguments) are supported in Terraform 1.11 and later.

- `customer_id` (String) ID of the customer this server belongs to
- `use_free_trial` (Boolean, [Write-only](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/resources/ephemeral#write-only-arguments)) Whether to use a free trial for this server, when available

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The generated server ID
- `short_id` (String) The short ID of the server

<a id="nestedatt--machine_type"></a>
### Nested Schema for `machine_type`

Required:

- `name` (String) The machine type name

Read-Only:

- `cpu` (Number) The number of CPUs; this is derived from the machine type
- `ram` (Number) The amount of RAM in GB; this is derived from the machine type
